message_1: A company has 9 employees, and they want to form a committee of at least 3 employees to plan a company event. In how many ways can the company form the committee if the committee must have an odd number of members?
message_2:
To form a committee with an odd number of members, the company can either form a committee of 3, 5, 7, or 9 employees. We will use the combination formula to find the number of ways to form a committee of each size, and then add them together.

The combination formula is: C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

For a committee of 3 employees:
C(9, 3) = 9! / (3!(9-3)!) = 9! / (3!6!) = 84 ways

For a committee of 5 employees:
C(9, 5) = 9! / (5!(9-5)!) = 9! / (5!4!) = 126 ways

For a committee of 7 employees:
C(9, 7) = 9! / (7!(9-7)!) = 9! / (7!2!) = 36 ways

For a committee of 9 employees:
C(9, 9) = 9! / (9!(9-9)!) = 9! / (9!0!) = 1 way

Now, we add the number of ways for each committee size together:

84 + 126 + 36 + 1 = 247 ways

So, there are 247 ways to form a committee with an odd number of members.
